entry.summary: The ZX Spectrum, one of the best-selling microcomputers of all time, celebrates its 40 years anniversary today. Read more about how the community is still active - creating new content, archiving old content, and hacking on all sorts of hardware.

entry.title: Removing the stigma of a CVE
entry.summary: Do you worry that a CVE will hurt the reputation of your project? In reality, CVEs are a tracking number, and nothing more. Here's how we think of them at GitHub.

entry.title: 5 simple things every developer can do to ship more secure code
entry.summary: From plug-and-play automations to protected branches, here are simple ways any developer can build more secure software on GitHub‚Äîall with a free account.

entry.title: Your guide to GitHub InFocus: Improving the way software development teams work in 2022
entry.summary: We‚Äôre kicking off InFocus, a global virtual event focused on accelerating, securing, and improving the way software development teams work.

entry.title: Improving Git push times through faster server side hooks
entry.summary: The history of pre-receive hooks, how we discovered that the performance was problematic, and how we went about safely replacing them.

entry.title: Organization profiles leading the way
entry.summary: Organization profiles can now display custom content visible only to members of the organization. A new Member view can be tailored to show an alternative README and pinned private repositories.

entry.title: Codespaces for multi-repository and monorepo scenarios
entry.summary: We‚Äôre releasing exciting improvements that will streamline your Codespaces experience when working with multi-repository projects and monorepos.

entry.title: Sharing security expertise through CodeQL packs (Part I)
entry.summary: Introducing CodeQL packs to help you codify and share your knowledge of vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Highlights from Git 2.36
entry.summary: Another new release of Git is here! Take a look at some of our highlights on what's new in Git 2.36.

entry.title: Security alert: Attack campaign involving stolen OAuth user tokens issued to two third-party integrators
entry.summary: On April 12, GitHub Security began an investigation that uncovered evidence that an attacker abused stolen OAuth user tokens issued to two third-party OAuth integrators, Heroku and Travis-CI, to download data from dozens of organizations, including npm. Read on to learn more about the impact to GitHub, npm, and our users.

entry.title: Announcing TypeScript 4.7 Beta
entry.summary: Today we are excited to announce the beta release of TypeScript 4.7! You can also get editor support by Downloading for Visual Studio 2022/2019 The post Announcing TypeScript 4.7 Beta appeared first on TypeScript.
